references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it directly addresses distributionally robust optimization in the context of imitation learning, a key topic of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Mitigating covariate shift in imitation learning via offline data with partial coverage
references.reason: This paper tackles the problem of covariate shift in offline imitation learning, which is the central focus of the current paper.

references.paper_title: D4RL: Datasets for deep data-driven reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper is critical as it provides the D4RL benchmark datasets, which are used in the experimental evaluation of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Imitation learning via off-policy distribution matching
references.reason: This work is highly relevant as it directly addresses the problem of covariate shift through distribution matching, and hence comparing against it is important.

references.paper_title: DualDICE: Behavior-agnostic estimation of discounted stationary distribution corrections
references.reason: This paper is crucial because it introduces the DICE algorithm, which is a core component of the proposed DrilDICE method in the current paper.
